title: Living in Locky: The Youth Perspective
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Victoria - Rural conditions
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Youth - Australia
abstract: Young local Emma McInnes interviews young people from Lockington about their perspectives of growing up in a rural town. Filmed as part of 'ACMI in the Regions: Stories from Lockington'.
description: 17 year old Locky local, Emma McInnes interviews a cross section of young people to find out what life in a rural town is really like. What is there to do? What the future holds and the all important question, are there many lookers in Locky?
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2001955; ACMI in the regions: Stories from Lockington; Active; 2009
